data.name: Unsigned byte
data.description:
You receive a value from the third party library. Unfortunately the value is an unsigned byte. Convert it to a integer.

Explanation:
What does unsigned mean? Signed means positiv or negative. In java byte, short, int and long always are signed. This means that the first bit (msb) represents the signe. 0 means it is a positive value, 1 means it is a negative value. 
For other programing languages this is not always true. They may have unsigned data types. This means they only have a value. If the value of an unsigned data type is provided to a java program, java still thinks the first bit means positive or negative.
